articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military ordered residents of 23 southern Lebanese villages on Saturday to evacuate to areas north of the Awali River, which flows from the western Bekaa Valley into the Mediterranean.
articles.title: Israel orders evacuation of more southern Lebanese towns amid rising displacement

articles.author: Daniel Leussink, Irene Wang
articles.description: Almost eight decades after an atomic bomb devastated her home town of Hiroshima, Teruko Yahata carries the scar on her forehead from when she was knocked over by the force of the blast.
articles.title: In Hiroshima, Nobel Prize brings survivors hope, sense of duty

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: After weeks of intensive diplomacy aimed at securing a ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah militants, the United States has settled on an altogether different approach: let the unfolding conflict in Lebanon play out.
articles.title: Caught between competing goals in Lebanon, US stays on the sidelines

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: About 150 people in Jabalia were killed this week, local officials said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 19 people in Gaza, tanks push north

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Nobody is sure how many Cubans seeking U.S. shores are lost among the strong currents, treacherous weather and shark-infested waters of the Florida Straits.
articles.title: Cubans are disappearing at sea in migrant exodus, leaving a painful void

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: It is easy to see Siesta Key's appeal, even after a hurricane.
articles.title: 'Paradise is still paradise' - Floridians vow to rebuild after two hurricanes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, plans to make her medical information public on Saturday in an effort to draw attention to Republican rival Donald Trump's refusal to do so, according to a Harris aide.
articles.title: Harris to release medical report, drawing contrast with Trump

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Lithuanians elect a new parliament on Sunday in a vote dominated by concerns over the cost of living and potential threats from neighbouring Russia, with the opposition Social Democrats tipped to emerge as the largest party but well short of a majority.
articles.title: Lithuanians elect new parliament amid cost of living, security worries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alex Salmond, the former First Minister of Scotland and a prominent figure in the Scottish independence movement, died on Saturday. He was 69.
articles.title: Alex Salmond, former first minister of Scotland, dies aged 69

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba intends to consider visiting the United States to meet the president-elect before the inauguration in January next year, the Yomiuri newspaper said on Sunday.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba to consider visiting US to meet president-elect, Yomiuri says
